Spartina juncea subvar. americana St.-Yves, Candollea 5: 84. 1932. Type. United States of America. bord des Creeks salés Basse Caroline, Michaux s.n. (holotype: P, not seen). Note: See Hitchcock (1908:153) for notes on the type specimen. Treatment of
Trachynotia juncea as a synonym of
Spartina patens follows Mobberley (1956).

var. monogyna M.A.Curtis, Boston J. Nat. Hist. 1: 136. 1837.
Spartina patens var. monogyna (M.A.Curtis) Fernald, Rhodora 49: 114. 1947. Type. United States of America. North Carolina: M.A.Curtis s.n. (holotype: GH [GH00295532!], Appendix Fig. 3). Note: Fernald (1947:115) referred to this specimen as “The isotype of Curtis’s variety in the Gray Herbarium…” and “The Curtis type or isotype ….”; it likely is the holotype.
